intro: Ardisia lhotskyana, commonly known as the Hottentot's ardisia, is a species of evergreen shrub native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Ericaceae, which includes plants adapted to acidic soils. The plant features small, glossy, dark green leaves and produces clusters of white or pale pink flowers. Its berries are typically bright red and contain several seeds. Ardisia lhotskyana is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and thickets.
